page.title: 03FARMING AROUND HOCKLEY.
page.content: THE AREA BEING SURVEYED IS A LOWLAND AREA VERY CLOSE TO SEA LEVEL AND THIS IS REFLECTED IN THE NATURE OF THE AGRICULTURE. DUE TO THE LOW NATURE OF THE LAND IT REQUIRES DRAINING IF IT IS TO BE USED FOR PURPOSES OTHER THAN PASTURE. THE MAJORITY OF THE AREA IS USED FOR PASTURE IN PARTICULAR DAIRY FARMING. IN ADDITION SOME AREAS ARE USED FOR ARABLE PURPOSES, GENERALLY WHEAT BUT ALSO BARLEY. CLOSE TO HOCKLEY ITSELF THE LAND IS MAINLY PASTURE SOME OF WHICH IS USED FOR RIDING STABLES. IT IS NOT INTENSIVELY USED AS THERE ARE SEVERAL PLANS FOR FURTHER URBAN DEVELOPMENT IN THE AREA.
